item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, January 25, 2025 at 7:10 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Open Heart Protocol (113 points | 37 comments)
2. A FPGA friendly 32 bit RISC-V CPU implementation (42 points | 9 comments)
3. Show HN: I built a DIY plane spotting system at home (115 points | 33 comments)
4. DOGE Takeover of USDS Allows Them to Surveil the US Government from the Inside (61 points | 29 comments)
5. I got OpenAI o1 to play the boardgame Codenames and it's super good (152 points | 78 comments)
6. Pixelfed Hit 500K Users (186 points | 46 comments)
7. How far can you get in 40 minutes from each subway station in NYC? (170 points | 101 comments)
8. The Mythical IO-Bound Rails App (134 points | 28 comments)
9. Show HN: Krita RGBA Tech – Exploring Filter Engines in Open-Source Art (21 points | 2 comments)
10. Life lessons from the first half-century of my career (291 points | 98 comments)
11. How to build your own ZX80/ZX81 (2019) (59 points | 16 comments)
12. An overview of gradient descent optimization algorithms (2016) (100 points | 16 comments)

14. Why North England is poor (42 points | 31 comments)

20. Arsenal FC AI Research Engineer Job Posting (78 points | 74 comments)
21. File Explorer is merged to Helix editor (213 points | 28 comments)
22. Doorbell camera catches rare footage of meteorite striking home's front walkway (74 points | 40 comments)

24. TinyZero (174 points | 24 comments)
25. Wild – A fast linker for Linux (358 points | 178 comments)
26. Show HN: Lightpanda, an open-source headless browser in Zig (274 points | 128 comments)
27. Show HN: Habby – A straightforward bullet journal with habit tracking (40 points | 14 comments)
28. A phishing attack involving g.co, Google's URL shortener (342 points | 141 comments)
29. Men lose half their emotional support networks between 30 and 90 (6 points | discuss)
30. Snowdrop OS – a homebrew operating system from scratch, in assembly language (287 points | 64 comments)
